results.title: Learning to dive. Part 1. The Standing plain dive
results.brief_description: The progressive stages in learning to dive, the preliminary exercises and the way to gain proficiency. Demonstrated by a class of children aged 8-14 years. Part one: confidence exercises in shallow water; simple dives in four positions from the side of the pool; practice in the correct stance, jumping and arm movements; jumps into the water at the deep end and finally correct standing dives.

results.title: Learning through movement
results.brief_description: Dance classes are taught at Sycamore Elementary School, California, as part of the weekly curriculum. The key is “total involvement” - the child puts their whole being into an experience; their body, mind, emotions, imagination and enthusiasm. The theory says that creative movement promotes harmony of the inner person with their body. Shows classes being held over a period of time with groups of children of all ages.

results.title: Learning the butterfly stroke
results.brief_description: Shelagh Ratcliffe, national champion demonstrates the butterfly stroke. Children are seen at various levels performing a range of appropriate practices. Also demonstrates the racing start, a simple two hand “grab” turn, and the more advanced “tumble turn”.

results.title: Learning problems : diagnosis and action (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Edward Milner, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personality and Learning”.
Detailed account of some motor skills tasks, also concept and language tasks used for diagnosis and remediation with children showing specific learning difficulties. Demonstrates language master and Reynell language scales.

results.title: Learning lacrosse. Part two. Defence
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Walford Hewitson and Douglas Jackson
results.brief_description: Using close-up, slow-motion and stop-motion, the film clearly demonstrates the tricks of play that might otherwise be too fast or complicated to see. Shows a series of defensive moves including cross checking and stick checking.

results.title: Learning is searching
results.creator_credit: L. Joseph Stone and Vassar College, Dept. of Child study
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Vassar studies: studies of normal personality development”.
A third grade in the New Lincoln School studies tools and their origins. The process of search is stressed. Shows the relation of these studies to the group’s other school activities. Presents the enthusiasm as well as the limitations of the children.

results.title: Learning in Britain
results.brief_description: No nation has a monopoly of knowledge but many centuries of learning and experience have made Britain a centre of study which attracts students from every part of the world. Famous places of learning are visited including universities, medical and agricultural schools, the great Inns of Court, and training colleges for teachers.
